text: Ha I see what you mean, just happened to me :upside_down_face:
It’s def not a major issue, but until we get the cleanup of our different systems it’s preventing complete installs.

<@U25C65C3S> that error should only be shown if `min > 0` and `default = null` (similar to how we'd throw that error if `min > 0 and default = 0`. are you saying you're seeing this error if `min = null`  and `default = null`?

No, don’t have issue with the error. Have issue with teh fact that it’s not been an issue for anything and the changes in the error notifications are causing errors on imports for code that historically has been fine uploading in the CLI

We’re having to go through all of our client portals right now and updating all of our “loops” in modules because there was no indication that this was an error when built. But now it’s preventing saving for any template that has the module in it.
Is there a changelog we can see or reference so that we know when these types of changes are made?
It looks bad on us as partners and developers when it’s a surprise
i'm going to revert this validation. will let you know when it's deployed
Thanks Briann, our app was running into the same issue trying to deploy modules, as of recently. Maybe it can just be a warning?
I definitely agree with Remington, I get why it was done. But would be nice to know as it can break older modules, or if it was backwards compatible.
